Method Detail

saveToken

public StatusMessage saveToken(java.lang.String nextToken,
                               boolean saveFlag,
                               java.lang.Object androidcontext)
save the Token to the device storage

Specified by:
saveToken in interface DeviceStorageInterface
Parameters:
token - the Token to save
SaveFlag - use true to save, false to abandon (this parameter is determined by other method that indicate the device data sending status)
androidcontext - the Android context of the mobile application activity's class (to access the private device storage)
Returns:
StatusMessage indicate the saveToken operation status (success, failed, error etc...)
  • if the storage operation was successful
    return: StatusMessage(true,DeviceStorage.saveToken() was successful)
  • if the saveflag is false, abandon the save operation
    return: StatusMessage(false,"DeviceStorage.saveToken() saveFlag is false")
  • if the an exception was found (FileNotFoundException, IOException)
    return: StatusMessage(false,"DeviceStorage.saveToken() [Exception Class Name]")
    See Also:
    android.content.Context, StatusMessage

    • saveGenFlag

    public StatusMessage saveGenFlag(boolean genFlag,
                                 java.lang.Object androidcontext)
    save the generator's flag

    Specified by:
    saveGenFlag in interface DeviceStorageInterface
    Parameters:
    genFlag - the generator's flag to save, genFlag is determined by other method that indicate the internet connection status (DeviceConnectionInterface.checkconnection)
    androidcontext - the Android context of the mobile application activity's class (to access the private device storage)
    Returns:
    StatusMessage indicate the saveGenFlag operation status (success, failed, error etc...)
  • if the storage operation was successful
    return: StatusMessage(true,DeviceStorage.saveGenFlag() was successful)
  • if the an exception was found (FileNotFoundException, IOException)
    return: StatusMessage(false,"DeviceStorage.saveGenFlag() [Exception Class Name]")
    See Also:
    android.content.Context, StatusMessage, DeviceConnectionInterface
